content.description: Sickle-cell anemia is an inherited blood disorder in which one of the hemoglobin subunits is replaced with a different form of hemoglobin. Partial <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sequences of the <math alttext="H B B" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>B</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></math> gene for normal hemoglobin and for sickle-cell hemoglobin are shown in Figure 1.
content.question: Partial sequence for normal hemoglobin: Partial sequence for sickle-cell hemoglobin: Figure 1. Comparison of partial <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></math> sequences for normal hemoglobin and hemoglobin with a sickle-cell mutation Which of the following best describes the type of mutation shown in Figure 1 that leads to sickle-cell anemia?
